Seal characters (1)

铙字的基本解释

铙
（鐃）
náo
铜质圆形的打击乐器，比钹大。
古代军中乐器，像铃铛，但没有中间的锤。

铙字的汉语字典释义

[①]［náo］
［《廣韻》女交切，平肴，娘。］
“铙1”的繁体字。
(1)古代军中用以止鼓退军的乐器。青铜制，体短而阔，有中空的短柄，插入木柄后可执，原无舌，以槌击之而鸣。三个或五个一组，大小相次，盛行于商代。《周礼·地官·鼓人》：“以金鐃止鼓。”郑玄注：“鐃，如鈴，無舌，有秉，執而鳴之，以止擊鼓。”贾公彦疏：“進軍之時擊鼓，退軍之時鳴鐃。”又《夏官·大司马》：“鳴鐃且卻，及表乃止。”郑玄注：“鐃所以止鼓，軍退，卒長鳴鐃以和衆鼓人，爲止之也。”《宣和博古图》有汉舞铙，其形上圆下方，下作疏棂，中含铜丸谓之舌，鼓动有声，为乐舞时所用。
(2)一种打击乐器。形制与钹相似，唯中间隆起部分较小，其径约当全径的五分之一。以两片为一副，相击发声。大小相当的铙与钹，铙所发的音低于钹而馀音较长。
(3)通“磽”。恶，坏。
[②]［nào］
［《集韻》女教切，去效，娘。］
同“撓1”。“铙2”的繁体字。
扰乱。

铙字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鐃； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1328第06
【唐韻】女交切【集韻】【正韻】尼交切【韻會】泥交切，?音呶。【說文】小鉦也。軍法，卒長執鐃。【玉篇】似鈴無舌，軍中所用也。【釋名】鐃，聲鐃鐃也。【周禮·地官·鼓人】以金鐃止鼓。【註】鐃如鈴，無舌，有柄，執而鳴之，以止擊鼓。　又奏樂所用也。【禮·樂記】始奏以文，復亂以武。【註】文謂鼓，武謂金，鐃樂始奏先擊鼓，亂猶言終也。鼓聲爲陽，故謂文。鐃聲爲隂，故謂武。文以始之，武以收之，言節奏得宜也。　又【博古圖】漢舞鐃二，其形上圜下方，下作疏櫺，中含銅丸，謂之舌鼓，動有聲。　又樂府有鐃歌，軍中鼓吹曲也。　又與譊通。【後漢·五行志童謠】今年尚可，後年鐃。○按風俗通作譊。　又【集韻】【正韻】?女敎切，與橈同。【莊子·天道篇】萬物無足以鐃心者。

考證：〔【周禮·地官·封人】以金鐃止鼓。〕　謹照原文封人改鼓人。

铙字的起名意思

铜质圆形的打击乐器，比钹大。古代军中乐器，像铃铛。铜制圆形的乐器，常和钹配合演奏。

cymbals
Basic explanation of words
cymbals
(cymbals)
náo
A round copper percussion instrument, larger than a cymbal.
An ancient military musical instrument, like a bell, but without a hammer in the middle.
cymbals
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [náo]
["Guangyun" female cross-cut, flat meal, mother. ]
Traditional characters for "铙1".
(1) A musical instrument used to stop the retreat of the drum in the ancient army. It is made of bronze, short and broad, with a hollow short handle. It can be held after being inserted into a wooden handle. It has no tongue. It screams with a hammer. Groups of three or five, similar in size, prevailed in the Shang Dynasty. "Zhou Li·Diguan·Drumman": "Stop the drum with Jinxuan." Zheng Xuan's note: "The bell, like a bell, without a tongue, has a spirit, insists and screams to stop drumming." Jia Gongyan Shu: " Beat the drums when you advance, and sound when you retreat." And "Xiaguan·Da Sima": "Bing and stop, but the appearance is only." Zheng Xuan's note: "So the drum stops, the army retreats, and the soldier continues to sound. "Xuanhe Bogutu" has a Han dance, with a shape of a circle on the top and a circle on the bottom, and the bottom is a loosening. The copper ball in the middle is called the tongue, which is used for agitation and sound. It is used in music and dance.
(2) A percussion instrument. The shape is similar to that of a cymbal, except that the middle bulge is smaller, and its diameter is about one-fifth of the full diameter. Take two pieces as a pair and strike each other to make a sound. Cymbals and cymbals of the same size, the sound produced by the cymbal is lower than the cymbal and the remaining sound is longer.
(3) Through "硗". Evil, bad.
[②]［nào］
["Jiyun" female teaches cutting, to effect, mother. ]
Same as "scratch 1". "铙2" in traditional characters.
disturb.

[Note] The bell is like a bell, has no tongue, has a handle, and sings while holding it to stop drumming.　It is also used for playing music again. [Li·Yue Ji] Begin to play with texts, and use martial arts for rebellion. [Note] Wen is the drum, Wu is the gold, and the drums are played first, but the chaos is still the end. The drum sound is yang, so it is called literary. The clank is yin, so it is called Wu. Its shape is above and below the bottom, and the bottom is sparse, with copper balls in the middle, which is called the tongue drum, and it moves with sound.　Yuefu also has a song, and the army also preaches a song.　 and Xiaotong again. [Later Han · Five Elements Nursery Rhymes] This year is acceptable, but the next year. ○According to the common customs.　[Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun]? Female cut, same as Radius. 【Zhuangzi·The Way of Heaven】There is no such thing as a heart-hearted person.
